meanings.definition: The quality or state of being educable.
meanings.sent1: Her educabilities shone through when she quickly grasped the new concept.
meanings.sent2: The students' educabilities varied, with some picking up the material faster than others.
meanings.sent3: His educabilities were put to the test when he had to learn how to juggle in a day!
meanings.sent4: The educabilities of the team were like a well-oiled machine, smoothly adapting to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The educabilities of the young minds were like sponges, eagerly soaking up knowledge.

meanings.sent1: The educabilities of the children were evident as they eagerly participated in class.
meanings.sent2: Access to education is crucial for individuals to develop their educabilities.
